dspace-cli.title: Spike on what would need to be supported with the management of Community-level documentation

comments.body: Following the meeting held today with one of the DataSpace stakeholders, supporting this in either DataSpace or the Open Access Repository would require modifying the JSPUI theme in order to ensure that user-supplied descriptions for collections are rendered as styled HTML (currently, they are not at all rendered, regardless of what is persisted in the database).

dspace-development.title: Provide documentation for integrating and testing dspace-jruby with DSpace

comments.body:
https://github.com/pulibrary/dspace-development/compare/issues-13-jrgriffiniii-jruby advances this, however, attempting to use an older release of `bundler` in the Docker environment yields the following:

```
pulsys@1ee4c7a8cfb3:/usr/local/src/dspace-jruby$ bundle install --path vendor/bundle                                                                                                                  [DEPRECATED] The `--path` flag is deprecated because it relies on being remembered across bundler invocations, which bundler will no longer do in future versions. Instead please use `bundle config s
et path 'vendor/bundle'`, and stop using this flag
There was an error while trying to write to
`/home/pulsys/.bundle/cache/compact_index/rubygems.org.443.29b0360b937aa4d161703e6160654e47/versions`.
It is likely that you need to grant write permissions for that path.
```

I've been trying to find the root cause of this, and it seems that https://rubygems.org/gems/bundler/versions/1.10.6 predates https://github.com/rubygems/bundler/pull/5007.  I will attempt another JRuby and Bundler release.

It seems that attempting to use RVM is going to introduce problems regardless for Docker Container environments. This will force us to support requiring later releases of `bundler` and `jruby`:

```
root@1ee4c7a8cfb3:/usr/local/src/dspace-jruby# apt-cache show jruby
Package: jruby
Architecture: all
Version: 9.1.17.0-1~18.04
Priority: optional
Section: universe/ruby
Origin: Ubuntu
Maintainer: Debian Java Maintainers <pkg-java-maintainers@lists.alioth.debian.org>
[...]
root@1ee4c7a8cfb3:/usr/local/src/dspace-jruby# /usr/share/jruby/bin/gem install -v 1.16.1 bundler
root@1ee4c7a8cfb3:/usr/local/src/dspace-jruby# /usr/local/bin/bundle install
```
Attempting to work more with the `apt` release of JRuby yielded: https://github.com/rubygems/bundler/issues/6878#issuecomment-568136971
Downloading the TAR from https://www.jruby.org/download proved to be effective for installing the dependencies.

https://github.com/pulibrary/dspace-development/compare/issues-13-jrgriffiniii-jruby?expand=1 now uses the TAR release of JRuby (as opposed to any RVM or APT-based installations). This does lock the version of JRuby which can be supported for local development, but I simply do not know how this can be avoided due to the server environment issues.

The test failures are a false negative, this is due to the fact that the base image used by Molecule has `/usr/share/man/` directories removed (please see https://github.com/pulibrary/ubuntubionicimage/blob/dockerimage/Dockerfile#L15), yielding `error creating symbolic link '/usr/share/man/man1/rmid.1.gz.dpkg-tmp': No such file or directory` when attempting to install packages (please see https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/pulibrary/dspace-development/62/workflows/5ab9b6dc-6729-4c15-a2b3-ce67fece01c1/jobs/145)
The `README` does not provide instructions for installation Maven with `brew install maven`
References to `jrgriffiniii` in the README should be changed to `pulibrary` for working with Docker images.
The README should contain instructions for installing Docker on macOS.
The README should document the usage of `source ./scripts/docker_provision_local_storage.sh --start-at-task="my ansible task"`

When running `irb` as the `pulsys` user in Docker, there are file system permissions issues which must be resolved with the following: `chmod a+w -R /dspace/log`. Attempting to restrict access by just adding `pulsys` to the owning user group did *not* prove effective.

Further, `irb` should be invoked as `irb -I /usr/local/src/jruby-projects/dspace-jruby/lib`

A general outline for working with IRB should be added to the README:

```
pulsys@7ef9e5aeb441:/usr/local/src/dspace-jruby$ irb -I /usr/local/src/dspace-jruby/lib
irb(main):001:0> require 'dspace'
=> true
irb(main):002:0> DSpace.load
Using /dspace
Loading jars
Loading /dspace/config/dspace.cfg
INFO: Loading provided config file: /dspace/config/dspace.cfg
INFO: Using dspace provided log configuration (log.init.config)
INFO: Loading: /dspace/config/log4j.properties
Starting new DSpaceKernel
DB jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/dspace, UserName=dspace, PostgreSQL Native Driver
=> true
irb(main):003:0> DSpace.login('admin@localhost')
=> nil
irb(main):004:0> person = DEPerson.find('admin@localhost')
=> #<Java::OrgDspaceEperson::EPerson:0x6dca31eb>
```

comments.body: @kelea99 We've talked about merging LAE into DPUL before. In the past, we've felt like the history of the site and the grant funding justified maintaining a separate application. But I think it's worth comparing the current feature sets, and discussing the possibility with the stakeholders.

requests.title: Restore Standard (Pre-Covid) ReCAP Request Operations for Partner and PUL Items
Update the form to allow for edd submission
Implement Voyager Hold Request Per Item API

comments.body:
API Docs: https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/voyager/apis/restfulwebservices/recallperitem/. GET: https://webvoyage.princeton.edu:7014/vxws/record/11451836/items/8183358/hold?patron={user[:patron_id]}&patron_homedb={db_identifier}&patron_group={user[:patron_group]} ``` ok 0 .Firestone Library Circulation Desk 693 TSD Circulation Desk Architecture Library Circulation Desk Donald E. Stokes Library, Wallace Hall, Circulation Desk East Asian Library Circulation Desk Engineering Library Circulation Desk Firestone Microforms Services Annex A Circulation Desk Interlibrary Services Circulation Desk Lewis Library Circulation Desk Marquand Library Circulation Desk Mendel Music Library Circulation Desk Harold P. Furth Plasma Physics Library Circulation Desk Pre-Bindery Circulation Desk Preservation Office Circulation RECAP Circulation Rare Books and Special Collections Circulation Desk Seeley G. Mudd Library Circulation Desk Technical Services Circulation Video Collection: Video Circulation Desk ReCAP Shared Collection Borrow Direct Service. Princeton University Library zDatabase Maintenance Local Database Hold Request You have chosen to place a Hold rather than aRecall.

This means that the item you selected will be available for you when the user who currently has the item checkeded out returns it.
This may be up to a year.

If you need the item sooner, please place a Recall instead of a Hold.

If you have questions, please contact any library circulation desk. ]]> 2020-06-26 ``` Then PUT the same URL with this XML body. ``` 299 20200726 testing hold request {voyager_db_key} ```

There are non-circulating items within circulating locations. Example:

bib ID: 257717
item ID: 282630

If you perform a GET request for the item info via vxws:

`https://webvoyage.princeton.edu:7014/vxws/item/282630`

you get the following XML document:

`<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?><response><reply-text>ok</reply-text><reply-code>0</reply-code><item><itemData id=\"46\" name=\"permLocation\" code=\"f\">Firestone Library (F)</itemData><itemData id=\"0\" name=\"tempLocation\"/><itemData id=\"46\" name=\"location\" code=\"f\">Firestone Library (F)</itemData><itemData name=\"callNumber\">JK3401 .E462</itemData><itemData name=\"copy\">c. 1</itemData><itemData name=\"itemBarcode\">32101033513878</itemData><itemData name=\"enumeration\">vol.20(inc.)</itemData><itemData name=\"chron\">1994</itemData><itemData name=\"year\"/><itemData name=\"caption\"/><itemData name=\"freeText\"/><itemData name=\"typeCode\">2</itemData><itemData name=\"typeDesc\">NoCirc</itemData><itemData name=\"tempType\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"tempDesc\"/><itemData name=\"mediaType\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"mediadesc\"/><itemData name=\"itemStatus\">vol.20(inc.) 1994  Requests: 1</itemData><itemData name=\"itemStatusCode\">6</itemData><itemData name=\"itemDueDate\"/><itemData name=\"itemStatusDate\">2020-05-27 13:24:40</itemData><itemData name=\"todayDate\">2020-05-27 13:27:18</itemData><itemData name=\"pieceCount\">1</itemData><itemData name=\"amount\">0.00</itemData><itemData name=\"spineLabel\"/><itemData name=\"historicalCharges\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"historicalBrowses\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"historicalBookings\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"recallsPlaced\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"holdsPlaced\">1</itemData><itemData name=\"itemNote\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"reserveCharges\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"onReserve\">N</itemData><itemData name=\"shortLoanChgs\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"createDate\">2000-06-13</itemData><itemData name=\"createOperId\"/><itemData name=\"createLocation\"/><itemData name=\"modifyDate\"/><itemData name=\"modifyOperId\"/><itemData name=\"modifyLocation\"/><itemData name=\"lastTrans\"/><itemData name=\"clusterId\">1</itemData><itemData name=\"bibId\">257717</itemData><itemData name=\"libraryId\">1</itemData><itemData name=\"historicalReserveCharges\">0</itemData><itemData name=\"holdLocation\"/><itemData name=\"patronGroupCode\"/><itemData name=\"lastName\"/><itemData name=\"firstName\"/></item></response>`

The important thing to note here is `<itemData name=\"typeDesc\">NoCirc</itemData>`

If the item type is a non-circulating item type, the request should not be allowed.

Here are the non-circulating item types. This should be a definitive list. The types are case-sensitive.

`['NoCirc', 'Closed', 'Res-No']`
